acknowledgements.preferred citation: FMarkin, C. J., Mokhtari, D. A., Sunden, F., Appel, M. J., Akiva, E., Longwell, S. A., Sabatti, C., Herschlag, D. & Fordyce, P. M. Revealing enzyme functional architecture via high-throughput microfluidic enzyme kinetics. Science 373, eabf8761 (2021)

data source.source: This dataset was provided by the Polly Fordyce Group, Stanford University, with guidance from Dr. Craig Markin and Prof. Polly Fordyce.

annotations.additional documentation and resources: All data are available in a registered Open Science Foundation Repository (DOI: 10.17605/OSF.IO/QRN3C)
annotations.challenge problem: Score activity for each of the three substrates. The range of scoring is arbitrary.

data.substrate used in specific activity meas: Rmethyl phosphate (MeP) - chemistry limited substrate, Carboxy 4-methylumbelliferyl phosphate ester (cMUP) - binding limited substrate, methyl phosphodiester (MecMUP) - promiscuous substrate
